meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a medusa
meanings.sent1: The jellyfish had a medusoid appearance with its flowing tentacles.
meanings.sent2: The artist created a medusoid sculpture that captured the essence of a jellyfish.
meanings.sent3: The medusoid clouds in the sky seemed to dance playfully with the wind.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, cascading down her back, looked medusoid in its wild and untamed beauty.
meanings.sent5: The medusoid glow of the moonlight illuminated the dark forest.

meanings.definition: Having the form or structure of a medusa
meanings.sent1: The medusoid creature swam gracefully through the ocean depths.
meanings.sent2: The aquarium displayed a variety of medusoid organisms for visitors to see.
meanings.sent3: The medusoid costume at the party was a hit, with its flowing fabric and tentacles.
meanings.sent4: The medusoid architecture of the building made it stand out among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The medusoid pattern on the fabric resembled the intricate design of a jellyfish.
